column2: One seminar had 18 participants. It is known that :(1) At least 5 young teachers are female; (2) At least 6 female teachers are over middle age; (3) At least seven young women are teachers;
column3: According to the above information, which of the following can be concluded about the participants?
column4: Some young teachers are not women
column5: Some young women are not teachers
column6: There are at least 11 young teachers
column7: There are at least 13 female teachers

column2: MetroBank made loans to ten small companies, in amounts ranging from $1, 000 to $100, 000. These ten loans all had graduated payment plans, i. e. , the scheduled monthly loan payment increased slightly each month over the five-year term of the loan. Nonetheless, the average payment received by MetroBank for these ten loans had decreased by the end of the five-year term.
column3: Which one of the following, if true, most helps to resolve the apparent discrepancy in the statements above?
column4: Of the ten small companies, the three that had borrowed the largest amounts paid off their loans within three years.
column5: For some loans made by MetroBank, the monthly payment decreases slightly over the term of the loan.
column6: The number of small companies receiving new loans from MetroBank increased over the five-year term.
column7: Most banks offer a greater number of loans for under $100, 000 than for over $100, 000.
